quiz.question: What does 'What goes around comes around' imply?
Who is traditionally credited with authoring much of the Biblical Book of Proverbs?
Which rhetorical device is especially common in Biblical proverbs?
What is the meaning of 'Don't put all your eggs in one basket'?
Which poet wrote 'To err is human; to forgive, divine'?
Which rare label describes a proverb used as an argument in folk law or oral testimony?
Which proverb encourages starting early to gain advantage?
options: A rolling stone gathers no moss
Every cloud has a silver lining
The early bird catches the worm
quiz.answer: The early bird catches the worm

quiz.question: Which proverb teaches that small consistent efforts produce results?
options: Strike while the iron is hot
Mend fences while the sun shines

quiz.question: Which proverb became a slogan in risk management advising not to rely on a single option?
options: Don't put all your eggs in one basket
quiz.answer: Don't put all your eggs in one basket

quiz.question: Which proverb tells you to take action rather than only speak?
Which proverb is summarized by 'Less is more' in modern phrasing?
options: Too much of a good thing
Brevity is the soul of wit
Rome wasn't built in a day
quiz.answer: Too much of a good thing

quiz.question: Which Roman leader uttered 'Alea iacta est' when crossing the Rubicon?
Which proverb does the fable 'The Ant and the Grasshopper' illustrate?
Which 18th-century poet wrote the line that inspired 'the best-laid plans of mice and men'?
